column1: Once upon a time there were three bears who lived in a castle in a great wood. One of them was a great big bear
column2: and one was a middling bear
column3: and one was a little bear. And in the same wood there was a fox who lived all alone; his name was Scrapefoot. Scrapefoot was very much afraid of the bears
column4: but for all that he wanted very much to know all about them. And one day as he went through the wood he found himself near the Bears' Castle
column5: and he wondered whether he could get into the castle. He looked all about him everywhere
column6: and he could not see any one. So he came up very quietly
column7: till at last he came up to the door of the castle
column8: and he tried whether he could open it. Yes! the door was not locked
column9: and he opened it just a little way
column10: and put his nose in and looked
column11: and he could not see any one.
